messages.content: This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
Who can enroll the customer?
1. Retail FR (FRR) can enroll to BRO Customers. 2. UKU FR (FRW) can enroll to UKU Mechanics. 3. JMR can enroll to Bosch Extra mechanics. 4. SWS BP can enroll to NW customers.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
Which type of customers can be enrolled from the Mobile application?
Below types of customers can be enrolled via Mobile App: Retailer, Car Garage, CV Garage, NW, IW, UKU, Bosch Extra Mechanic.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
What are the conditions applicable in Enrollment?

1. Same Mobile No. cannot be enrolled with the same BMD Channel if one UID already is in Active status. 2. Blocked by HO customers are not considered for enrollment. 3. Retailer can be enrolled with any type of BMD like BMD SAC, BMD CV, BMD PC, RBIC, BBD. 4. CV Garage, NW, UKU Mechanic can be enrolled under BMD SAC & BMD CV. 5. Car Garage, IW, Bosch Extra Mechanic can be enrolled under BMD PC. 6. Authorized Workshop flow from eFocus, or Area Manager can send details in defined format to techsupport.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
How does the Enrollment cycle work for BRO Customers?

1. FR/BP SWS BP logins to Bosch Infocom Mobile Application. 2. Submit Enrollment with all necessary details. 3. BMD login to Mobile Application and approve the enrollment (Customer Code generated). 4. BMD uploads the NEFT details - If NEFT already submitted for same Mobile No., it will be auto clubbed. 5. Area Manager will approve the Enrollment. 6. Agency will verify the enrollment. 7. Channel Manager will approve the enrollment.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
How does the Enrollment cycle work for UKU Mechanics?

1. FR-UKU logins to Bosch Infocom Mobile Application. 2. Submit Enrollment with all necessary details. 3. BMD login to Mobile Application and approve the enrollment (Customer Code generated). 4. Zonal Manager will approve the Enrollment.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
How does the Enrollment cycle work for Bosch Extra Mechanics?

1. JMR logins to Bosch Infocom Mobile Application. 2. Submit Enrollment with all necessary details. 3. JM login to Mobile Application and approve the enrollment. 4. Channel Manager will approve the Enrollment.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
What is the process for copying a customer?

1. The Copy Customer option is applicable for all unauthorized customers. 2. FR will log in to the Mobile app and enter the Mobile No. which is already enrolled in the program. 3. Blocked customers cannot be copied by entering Mobile No. 4. A customer can be copied within the same Customer channel. 5. Same Mobile No. cannot be copied in the same BMD Channel as one BMD Channel = one UID. 6. All information will copy other than Geo Code. 7. The approval process will remain the same as per new enrollment.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
Where can I find the current Enrollment Status?
1. User can refer to the Single Customer Information Report available under Master Menu.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
How Geo Verification process work?

Geo Verification can be done by any application user (FR to HO). Geo Verification Process application for Existing Enrolled Customer, Authorised Customer flow from eFocus & Not already available with 8 Digit SAP Code. After Geo Verification, NEFT Submission, AM Approval, Agency Verification & Channel Manager Approval (Other than Authorised Customers) is mandatory for any transactions like Order, Incentive Calculation. etc.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
What is the Process for Geo Modification?

Geo Request can be sent by FR or BP during Mark Visit or Order Submission (Cumulative Order Value >20K) if any Incentive not paid for customer - AM has to approve the Geo Modification request from customer location. If Incentive Already Paid for Customer then BP/AM/ZM has to do the Mark Visit from Failure Location and share the Location to techsupport@pearlcomp.com with HO approval, Technical Support team will update the same from backend.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
What is the meaning of Geo Failure?
Geo Failure is when the coordinates of the customer location differ significantly from the actual visit location, causing an inaccurate Geo Verification.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
Who can approve Geo Modifications?
Geo Modifications can be approved by Area Managers (AM) or Zone Managers (ZM), with additional approval from the Channel Manager when needed.

Is NEFT mandatory for Payout?
Yes, NEFT is mandatory during New Enrollment or Geo Verification for AM Approval as in 2020 policy only NEFT is payout mode.

Who can submit the NEFT details?
BMD can submit the NEFT details via Web Portal or any user from FR to User can submit the same from Mobile Application.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
What are mandatory documents for NEFT?

Cancel Cheque and Consent Form with Seal or Sign are mandatory for NEFT submission (If Name is not imprinted on cancel cheque then Passbook copy to be submit the Cancel cheque for Beneficiary verification).
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
What are the possible reasons for NEFT rejection?
NEFT may be rejected due to incorrect account details, mismatch of name in the documents, or any discrepancies identified during the verification process.
This is a factual chatbot that answers queries related to customer enrollment, geo verification, NEFT registration, and more.
What should I do if NEFT is rejected?
If NEFT is rejected, the user will be notified via email. They can update the details and resubmit with correct information.
